Dystrophin.Definition: A protein that is a translation product of the DMD gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof. (PRO)  It is a 427-kDa cytoskeletal protein that is a member of the family of β-spectrin/α-actinin proteins that are characterized by an NH2-terminal actin-binding domain followed by a variable number of repeating units known as spectrin-like repeats.  Mutations in the DMD gene are involved in Duchenne's Muscular Dystrophy.
